    • Constructor Detail

      • KeyValueMapWriter

        public KeyValueMapWriter(java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<?>,PersistenceRenderer> renderers,
                 PersistenceRenderer arrayRenderer,
                 java.lang.String keySeparator)
        Constructs a basic key-value writer that uses the specified renderers and separator.
        Parameters:
        renderers - The mapping between the Class represented by an InfoNode and the PersistenceRenderer used to create the key-value pair.
        arrayRenderer - The PersistenceRenderer used to create key-value pairs for InfoNodes that represent an array.
        keySeparator - The separator between the flattened elements of the key
        See Also:
        AbstractKeyValueBuilder.getRenderer(Class)

      • KeyValueMapWriter

        Constructs a basic key-value writer that uses the default renderers and specified separator.
        Parameters:
        keySeparator - The separator between the flattened elements of the key

    • Method Detail

      • getKeyValueFlattener

        public KeyValueFlattener getKeyValueFlattener()
        Returns:
        The flattener used to flatten the object into a list of key-value pairs

      • setKeyElementSeparator

        public void setKeyElementSeparator(java.lang.String separator)
        The separator between the flattened key elements. For example, suppose that a Division has a List of Person objects, called people. The the key for a person's first name may be of the form: Division.people.Person[2].firstName, or Division:people:Person[2]:firstName. The "." and the ":" are separators.
        Parameters:
        separator - The separator

      • getKeyElementSeparator

        public java.lang.String getKeyElementSeparator()
        Returns:
        The separator between the flattened key elements. For example, suppose that a Division has a List of Person objects, called people. The the key for a person's first name may be of the form: Division.people.Person[2].firstName, or Division:people:Person[2]:firstName. The "." and the ":" are separators.

      • getBuilder

        public KeyValueBuilder getBuilder()
        Returns:
        the KeyValueBuilder responsible for creating the key-value pairs from the semantic model, and that is responsible for parsing the key-value pairs into a semantic model.

      • createMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> createMap(InfoNode rootNode)
        Creates a Map that contains the flattened object. The key into the map is the flattened field name, and the value is the string representation of that value.
        Parameters:
        rootNode - The root InfoNode of the semantic model
        Returns:
        a Map that contains the flattened object. The key into the map is the flattened field name, and the value is the string representation of that value.
